intro: Notopleura madida, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Notopleura madida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
